column2: 13-18 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$WHY IS THIS NOT THE FIRST THING DOCTORS PRESCRIBE? Honestly the best thing. Grades went from 50 to 85's in 2 months!

column1: 3$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/21/2016 8:14:09 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years$5$5$5$Just wish that the stigma didn't make it so hard for people
column2: who need it
column3: to get. Its not as though this has helped our country's drug epidemic. It really does help me be a more functional human being. Its like my brain waves normally vary from FM to AM and this makes it XM-style crystal clear. I even notice about two weeks of improved function after not having access to the medication. Then sadly it all comes back... Finding a doctor willing to prescribe to an adult is much more difficult than it used to be and my last doctor was very old and started having health problems. Since then I have moved and the 3 months that seems standard to wait to be seen (poor peoples' insurance) coupled with the ADD is an obstacle to treatment in and of itself. I have spent the last couple of hours researching potentially more accessible alternatives
column6: this is certainly the gold standard.

column1: 4$Condition: Other$7/17/2015 6:54:55 PM$Reviewer: Lavender rrr
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$I started taking this about 4 months ago in combination with Wellbutrin XL and Ativan. My doctor prescribed it for my depression since SSRIs and SNRIs haven't really worked for me and the highest dose of Wellbutrin still didn't get me to a stable point. I really like it so far
column3: I don't dread getting out of bed as much anymore and my overall mood has improved
column4: My depression and even my anxiety a bit because I can finally focus enough to actually use coping skills. I was in college when I started taking it and my grades went from low 60s to mid 80s within a week
column5: I stopped living miserably in my own filth because I finally have the energy to clean and get things done now instead of sleeping all day. I have had some side effects
column6: it seems to make me a bit irritable at times
column8: not to the point that i've had to increase my Ativan dose though. It also doesn't seem to mix well with alcohol and makes me smoke more and eat less
column9: but overall I'd say it's effective.

At first I didn't know if it worked or not until I realized I now learn in class when I didnt before. The side effects have brought me down though. I get diarrhea
column3: nausea and vomit(I usually only vomit if I am in a situation I perceive as stressful
column4: like tests). The diarrhea really gets to me sometimes

column6: but this is the only medicine that has helped my ADD and bc of that has also helped my depression. Not too fond of it but I guess it's better than the alternative

column1: 8$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/23/2014 5:28:35 AM$Reviewer: unconqueredmind
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I'm a 30-yr-old male diagnosed with severe - ADHD aged 29. Been on Dexedrine IR 15mg x 3 daily for 2 months and I find it a superb medication for controlling impulsivity. Very few side-effects and unlike Ritalin IR if I miss or am late taking my next dose I don't get that deflated
column3: low feeling. It really is a smooth ride all the way. Probably the best ADHD-stimulant med for controlling restlessness and thus results in a significant improvement in my day to day organisation. My ability to concentrate on tasks is now within the spectrum of normal
column4: in fact I'd say at the top end of normal.  My only criticism is that for me it's slightly less motivating than Ritalin so if your a daydreaming procrastinator maybe that might be a better choice. However I find Dexedrine improves my ability to multi-task whereas Ritalin decreases it because it forces me to lock-on to a task like a robot. All in all

column1: 9$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/25/2014 12:25:20 AM$Reviewer: catsback54

column1: 10$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/27/2013 4:36:12 PM$Reviewer: NextKlenneration
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$2$3$If you also suffer from depression
column3: I personally do not recommend dexedrine. Started taking 5mg twice a day my junior year of college after being diagnosed ADD.  Upon first use I believed it was a wonder drug
column4: I had tons of energy and I could actually concentrate.  Worked great for about 1/2 year
column5: then started building up a dependence. Started on 10mg twice a day eventually.  If I missed a dose I would fall into a deep depression.  Destroyed my appetite
column6: made me feel generally unhealthy after 6 months use.  I really don't think this drug should be prescribed at all.  There's a reason it's a schedule II narcotic.  It makes you feel *too* good.   I am convinced that this drug completely re-wired my brain
column7: now whenever I have a stimulant such as caffeine
column8: I go into hyper-euphoria mode for about an hour
column9: then crash with huge amounts of fatigue and depression.   I would recommend any other add stimulant over this.  There is a reason this drug is hardly prescribed anymore.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I was recently diagnosed with ADHD; as an adult female I'm surprised I was actually diagnosed in the first place seeing as how many women fall through the cracks. column1: 20$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/12/2011 3:49:35 AM$Reviewer: Sheridan
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$"I have been taking this medication for two months and I have really noticed a difference in my ability to stay focused during conversation.  I talk to people for a living and often find myself daydreaming in the middle of conversations and my procrastination factor has been totally cut in half.  I am tacking tasks that I usually ""save until tomorrow"" and that tomorrow never comes.  I think things are only going to get better when I start therapy.  It's too bad that adult ADHD has become so controversial.  I started to figure it out in my late 20's and before I had some sort of learning disability but was just higher functioning.  Why did it always take me double or triple the house to complete a paper in school when it took my best friend the ""normal"" amount of time?  Ha.  Feels good to not feel so crazy anymore and to have some confirmation.  Thank you to my provider for going out on a limb and giving it a chance when I was only asking for Wellbutrin! :-)"

column1: 21$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/7/2011 1:07:28 AM$Reviewer: Stephs2014

column1: 22$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/21/2011 9:51:53 PM$Reviewer: Ridgerunner007
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been on Dexedrine Spansule since 1997
column3: fourteen yrs
column4: it is the best stimulant med I have ever taken for ADHD. I was given the diagnosis during 1994 at age 45. The 1st 3 yrs I took Ritalin 20mg x 3 tabs per day. Methylphenidate changed my life for the positive
column10: switching to Dexedrine Spansule 15mg in the AM hours
column12: having the Dexedrine Sulfate 5 mg instant release
column15: GlaxoSmithKline removed the Dexedrine 5 mg tabs off of the USA market in 2009
column17: I now take Adderall 12.5 mg when the early AM dose of pure Dexedrine Spansule wears off. The Dexedrine I/R 5 mg I liked better
column18: for 3 to 4 hrs of focusing ability
column21: Adderall or generic Adderall instant release. My deepest regret is not getting the ADHD diagnosis until age 45
column22: because I had crystal clear symptoms since at least age 7
column24: I lost 38 yrs of my life
column28: 7 yrs to complete a 4 year Bachelors Degree
column29: etc. Thus I am damaged merchandise
column32: one dozen books written by M.D's & Ph.D's have helped
column34: with attendance to some national ADDA conventions. Drug trials with any other form of Ritalin/Methylphenidate
column39: have not measured up to brand name Dexedrine. I also prefer the brand name Dexedrine Sulfate
column42: due to the FDA's non regulation of the bioavailability (breakdown of the med in the body) with generic firms...as regulation of the bioequivalence
column44: just my 2 cents worth.  The price of the generics vs. the brand name ""borders highway robbery""

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"I have several chronic conditions one being chronic fatique.  I have been on this medication for over two years. Before I started to take it I was in bed by 8
column3: slept till 9 a.m.; had a 3-4 nap one to two times a day.  I was unable to function which increased the severity of my other condtions.

column1: The side effects have been severe in some areas - but the ability to stay awake
column2: not having to nap my life away.  I am concerned about the long term affects on my mind and body
column3: as both are taking a ""beating"".  I take over 700 pills a month - about 25 a day.  Plus I take an acute pain med and ativan 2 mg when I begin to have the tics.

column1: I am very careful with this med as it has a lot of side effects; especially if I do not know if the effects are from the drug or the disorder.
I hope that my information has helped. I cannot stress enough how important it is to journal and/or track how you are doing so you can ensure your Doctor knows everything.
Take Care
Live
column2: Love & Laugh

column1: 41$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/6/2009 11:47:26 PM$Reviewer: A1A5KA
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$3$4$I was diagnosed two years ago with ADHD Combined Type
column3: which means that I vary between being a lethargic daydreamer and an scatterbrained chatterbox.  My doctor and I are still trying to find the best medication and dosage to treat me
column4: but so far I have found the Dex to be the most effective.  I have found that the Dex evens out my thinking and my energy level and controls my hyperactive impulses so that I am in control of my own behavior.  Currently
column5: I am taking 3 doses of Dex (7.5 mg each) per day
column6: about 4-5 hours apart.  One of the reasons I like the Dex is that I have experienced very few side effects with this medication.  Due to a sensitive digestive system
column8: nausea is often a side effect of medications
column9: but I have avoided this with the Dex by always taking it with food.  I also found that (for me) taking the medication with a caffeinated beverage causes intense headaches.  The only remaining effects I have found to be bothersome is that the medication begins to wear off after about 3 hours.  At that time
column11: I get very drowsy and second
column12: the medication stops controlling my hyperactivity.  Unfortunately
column13: these two effects do not cancel themselves out
column14: but rather leave me sprawled sleepily in a chair while my fingers drum and my mind races!  For me
column15: lower dosages have no effect and higher dosages make me so drowsy that any positive effects are negated.  Other ADHD medications I have tried (and rejected) include Strattera and Ritalin.

column1: 42$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/16/2009 6:00:04 AM$Reviewer: DexysMidNightRun
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on hyper medications since i was 4 yrs old ranging from ritalin to strattara to dexedrine ritalin gave me horrible head twitches which made school very hard got in more fights even in elementry got on dexedrine and it worked when i would take it but i was 12 when i got on it and wouldnt take it much stopped takin it when i was 13 when i got expelled from school never took anyothers till the past yr and decided to finally try again and now i find myself wishing i would have taken it through out my whole childhood cuz the changes it has made in my life are amazing i can actually get up and do stuff that needs done not only what i want done i can concentrate now it even helped my love life my wife noticed the differance very quickly i am currently on 5 10 mg capsules a day 3 in the morning and 2 in the after noonish the only problem i have had is if i take it too late i dont sleep that usally ends up makin me take over my normal dose cuz when i finally get tired its too late to sleep but other then that its a godsend i even went back to school and got my ged and am currently in college and i am a 28 yr old male that stopped goin to school at age 13 and never went back till now and got my ged on my first try it was amazing! who ever made this drug should get MAJOR props for it!!

column1: 45$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/10/2008 9:06:00 AM$Reviewer: Murr

column4: and now 30 mg ( 20 in morning and 10 at Noon).  I feel more focused when on to 30mg but I am covered for only 8 hours.  How do you know the optimal dosage for you? Also

column1: 47$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/1/2008 10:07:31 AM$Reviewer: JillianP456
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have used dexedrine for almost 16 years (since 5th grade) and agree that it has been a life-saver. To be completely honest
column3: I never write reviews like this
column5: I know I wouldn't be the successful ivy league graduate I am today without dexedrine. I take a low dose- 5 mg twice a day - which has made an enormous difference.  Dexedrine makes me feel refreshed
column7: and efficient. I have never felt any side effects
column8: besides occasional loss of appetite. I also easily discontinue use on weekends
column9: with no withdrawal symptoms (I do not have an addictive personality though).  I have taken my sister's concerta before
column10: and felt as though it was not comparable to dexedrine.  My only issue with dexedrine is the difficulty in obtaining prescriptions.  Doctors require psychological evaluations every 3 years and pharmacies require a new doctor's prescription every time you need to refill (and often ID you). Regardless
column11: the benefits outweigh the drawbacks a hundred times over.

column1: 57$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/17/2007 9:18:44 PM$Reviewer: James
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I was currently on a regime of Adderall 20mgs 3xday.  I switched to XR Dexedrine 15mgs 2xday.  The difference is night and day.  It seemed like Adderall had ups and downs on my ability to concentrate and stay on task.  While Dexedrine seemed a lot more level throughout that day with no dips in concentration and staying on task.

column1: 58$Condition: Other$10/19/2007 10:58:48 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I've been taking this drug for over a year now for adult ADD. I believe this is a wonder drug that has enabled me to resume a normal life. When I take it every morning I don't really feel anything
column2: but to go without it my mind wanders and can't remain focused. I only wished I had discovered this drug earlier in life. I had always thought it was normal for me to daydream and not being able to focus. Not anymore!

column1: 59$Condition: Overweight$9/18/2007 4:30:59 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$3$Effective for weight loss -- I had a severe obesity problem and turned to dexedrine for a short while -- but I did feel some heart palpitations and was also afraid of developing an addiction.
